CONJUGATES: uniqueness | uniquely | more unique (informal) | most unique (informal)
ETYMOLOGY: From French unique, from Latin ūnicus ('single, sole'), derived from ūnus ('one').

MEANINGS.DEF_EN: Being the only one of its kind; unlike anything else; having no equivalent or equal.
MEANINGS.DEF_ZH: 独一无二的；仅有的；无可比拟的。
MEANINGS.SENT_EN: The fingerprint analysis confirmed that the pattern was unique to the suspect.
MEANINGS.SENT_ZH: 指纹分析证实该图案是嫌疑人独有的。

MEANINGS.DEF_EN: Very unusual, special, or remarkable, often implying a highly desirable or distinctive quality.
MEANINGS.DEF_ZH: 非常特别的；出众的；罕见的 (常用于褒义，表示与众不同且值得关注)。
MEANINGS.SENT_EN: She has a truly unique approach to problem-solving that impresses everyone.
MEANINGS.SENT_ZH: 她解决问题的方法确实很独特，给大家留下了深刻的印象。

REGISTER: General vocabulary, commonly used in art, design, personality descriptions, and marketing.
